definition: to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: but he left it to him on such terms as destroyed half the value of the bequest .
sentences.chinese: 但是，因爲附有條件，這份遺產便失去了一半價值。

sentences.english: Tears don't mean you're losing, everybody's bruising.
sentences.chinese: 眼淚並不意味着你失去了，大家的青腫。

sentences.english: But Cho refused to accept that, not wanting to lose the protectorate .
sentences.chinese: 但喬拒絕接受這一切，他不想失去保護權。

sentences.english: My life has no direction without her.
sentences.chinese: 沒有了她，我的生活就失去了方向。

sentences.english: He is a lovely boy but he has no family.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個可愛的男孩，但是卻失去了家人。

sentences.english: He seems to be grief-stricken due to the loss of a friend.
sentences.chinese: 他看起來極度憂傷是因爲失去了一個朋友。

sentences.english: The less girl were inconsolable at the loss of IT kitten.
sentences.chinese: 那個小女剛出生的孩子因失去她的小貓而傷心不已。

sentences.english: The thugs beat him senseless with a baseball bat.
sentences.chinese: 暴徒用棒球棒把他打得失去了知覺。

sentences.english: Those misfortunes almost deprived him of his reason.
sentences.chinese: 那些不幸事件幾乎使他失去理智。

sentences.english: Image CreditWhen reduced to begging in enclaves of humanity, the birds can often lose some of the wildness.
sentences.chinese: 在人類居住地乞食的鶴鴕漸漸的就會失去野性。

sentences.english: If the holder loses the interest, it's no big deal.
sentences.chinese: 如果持有人失去了利息，這樣就不會有大的交易。

sentences.english: I can't lose you, because you are too important for me.
sentences.chinese: 峩將県能失去你，因爲你對峩來說太過重葽。

sentences.english: But if you did come unhooked, here's a device that could save your life.
sentences.chinese: 但是如果你失去了保障，有一個裝置能拯救你的生命。

sentences.english: The sandglass remember the time we lost.
sentences.chinese: 沙漏記得我們失去的時間。

definition: to lose/to throw away/to discard/to cast away
I've got a solution!/to have a bun in the oven (abbr. for 有了胎[you3 le5 tai1])
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to suffer the painful loss of (a loved one etc)/to miss out on (an opportunity)/to fail to gain (victory etc)
to sink down to/to be reduced to (sth inferior)
not in the least/to completely lack
to change into/to turn into/to become
